intro: Mollinedia subternata, commonly known as the slender mollinedia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pale yellow to greenish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations.
